manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: 4 IN 1 Multi-functional Electric Shaver Tired of juggling multiple grooming tools and cluttered bathroom counters ? Our multi-functional electric razor is the answer to your grooming woes! With interchangeable heads, it easily transforms from a shaver to sideburns trimmer, nose hair trimmer, and facial cleansing brush. How to Replace the Shaver Head : To replace the shaver head, gently pull the shaver head upwards (do not rotate it left or right), and then install the desired grooming head such sideburns trimmer head, nose hair trimmer head, or facial cleansing brush head. Now you can enjoy the convenience of a multi-functional shaver !

Upgrade your grooming routine with our electric shaver, now with a facial cleansing brush head included ! The Facial cleansing brush allows for a deep clean, removing excess oils and leaving your skin feeling refreshed and clean. （Perfect for those with oily skin prone to breakouts, the facial cleansing brush provides a better level of cleanliness, reducing the risk of skin problems caused by excess oil.） It's simple to use-- just switch the shaver head with the facial cleansing brush head, wet your skin, apply your favorite cleanser or facial wash to the brush or your skin, and gently massage in circular motions (avoiding sensitive eye areas). Rinse your face with water and pat dry with a soft towel.

Sideburns and beard trimmers let your face more stylish The sideburns trimmer is equipped with three different sized limit combs (3mm, 5mm, and 7mm) that can be easily attached to adjust the length of your haircut. If you have long facial hair ,use sideburns trimmer first.

Get a clean shave with our electric razor equipped with self-sharpening blades that get sharper with each use. Experience a smooth and precise shave with the shaver featuring a floating head design that allows it to glide effortlessly over the contours of your face for a close and comfortable shave.

You can charge the shaver using the charging stand or through direct charging The charging stand is convenient for charging after use and keeping the razor clean and tidy. And the shaver comes with a USB cable, which you can use to recharge it quickly and easily via any USB plug adapter, power bank, car charger, or computer. Whether you're at home or on-the-go, our shaver offers great flexibility for shaving whenever and wherever you need it.

Packing Include: 1 * Electric razor 1 * sideburns trimmer 3 * Limit Combs (3mm, 5mm, 7mm) 1 * Facial Cleansing Brush Head 1 * Nose trimmer head 1 * Foldable Charging Stand 1 * USB Charging Cable 1 * Small Cleaning brush 1 * Razor Cap 1 * User Manual

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great razor with a couple of really minor issues
reviews.reviewText: Took a chance on this razor. Wanted one with a pivoting head, not just flexible, floating blades. The description doesn’t say it, but the head of the razor has good flexibility. It has 360 degrees of flex to follow the contours of my face. The individual blades are not floating blades, but they have enough give to work with the pivoting head to work well.I’ve only used the razor a couple of times, but it shaves well. It isn’t the best shaving razor I’ve had, but it is better than my old Norelco Aqua. I haven’t tried wet shaving with it, yet. Dry shaving is pretty good.The main thing I’m pleased about, other than the pivoting head, is the size of the thing. The photoshopped images that all the “off brand” razors use, where the razor is pasted into a stock image of some guy in the shower or something, make the razors look huge. Even the user images in the review section don’t give a good idea of scale. This razor is a very nice size. About 1/4” longer than my 5 year old Norelco, but slimmer in the hand. The head is nicely proportional to the size of the body, and smaller than some others. It cuts nicely right up to the edge of my beard.The back side of the razor is soft-touch plastic, not the hard, shiny stuff. Great feel!One gripe I have is about the blue LED indicators you see in all the photos. They are printed on the plastic of the razor so that they are close to the actual LED lights in the razor. BUT, the actual LEDs are green and they don’t line up with the blue icons printed. Maybe this is intentional, but it looks like a mistake. Better indicators would be nice. Not a very big gripe, I know...Oh, one more thing. Good and not so good. The razor comes with a stand that plugs in. I like the stand. I also like that it charges when you place the razor on the stand. Don’t need to fiddle with it to get it plugged in, just set it in the stand and it works. HOWEVER, the red LED charging light doesn’t change to tell you when it is done charging. It would be nice if the razor had an automatic system to stop charging when it is done, or at least a green light or some way to tell when the battery is fully charged. Excessive charging will eventually wear out the rechargeable battery.So, only minor gripes. The LED alignment and the charging issue. The razor shaves well and feels great ergonomically. The extra heads work fine, but weren’t the main reason I bought this shaver, so in my mind, they are just a bonus.I’ll try to post some decent photos later that show the actual size of the razor in proper scale. Will also try to remember to update after a few months to report on longevity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works really well
reviews.reviewText: So instead of buying yet another replacement head for my 7 year old Norelco SensoTouch, I decided to give this one a shot (because it was 20 bucks).Very pleasantly surprised. I cant say anything to the product's battery life and/or longevity, as Ive only had it for a week. As for the results, it shaves just as close as the SensoTouch. Not as easy to clean since you cant pop the head off and remove the blades entirely, but the shave is close and cleaning it is easy enough. It doesnt "feel" as well made, so my guess is it wont last multiple years (and even if it did, I doubt you can buy replacement heads) but for 20 bucks even if it's only a disposable it's not a bad deal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works well. Battery drains quickly, but the percentage display is a nice touch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars So many functions..
reviews.reviewText: Packaged like it came from the dollar store. A storage bag would have been a nice addition. I feel like no part of this shaver will last very long, but I can’t say for sure because I’ve only had it for a week, but it has a wide range of functionality via the included attachments:1. The 3-pad rotary shaver head works well, no complaints and no injuries or irritation. Again, who’s to say how long it will stay sharp.2. The trimmer attachment also works just fine for manscaping. You could also probably cut your hair in a pinch.3. The nose-hair attachment. If, like me, you have long complained about the lack of power available to battery-powered nose-hair trimming wands, then you’re in luck with this device. I think I can confidently state that you will never find a nose-hair trimmer with more torque than this device+attachment. It may even be worth buying for that alone.4. There’s a brush attachment. I think the idea is you are supposed to apply shaving cream to your face? But who uses an electric shaver with shaving cream? IDK, anyway, it spins around. If that’s what you need, a spinning brush, then this is a bonus.5. The remaining hunk of plastic included in the box is a stand. The idea is that it folds out and you plug the charger into the back, inserting the shaver into the top where it balances, standing up, while it charges. Unfortunately, I could not get it to work. I cleaned the contacts and fiddled with it for a while. Theres a short somewhere in it, but in truth, it looks like the balancing will be precarious at best and fall over all the time, so I gave up trying to make it work.Thats a lot of stuff which mostly works just fine. When I tested charge/discharge, my results were 1:40:15 to charge completely from 0, and 2:45:05 to discharge (just sitting there running with no resistance other than the shaver head being installed.) so do whatever you like with that information.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Clogs up fast! Hard to open...
reviews.reviewText: This shaver does fine if you have fine stubble or light growth, however if you have a real beard... This thing does not take on the task well. It does not have a large enough area to hold whiskers as you shave, and cleaning this mid-shave is not ideal by any stretch of the imagination.All three heads have to be tilted outward from the middle of the shave head in order to clean it out. This requires nails, if you trim your nails short like I do then opening it requires a pocket knife or another tool to press in the buttons... While opening the other heads one may close on you leaving you to have to open 4-5x just to clean it out. For this reason of the non-existent tension while heads are open there is no "tapping the shaver out in the sink" mid shave.As far as the other accessories, I got a trimmer in mine. It was supposed to come with a face brush? I did not get one in mine and even triple checked the listing... Because of how cheap it was I didn't bother sending in for a replacement. It would of made it worth having though. I likely will toss it or keep it in a drawer as a last resort backup now...I would not recommend this to a friend because it's missing parts and is super hard to open the shaving head. (also mine appeared to be opened already and a possible returned item... That could be part of the issue...)
I bought this as a gift, friend said it was good
It is very comfortable to handle and gives you a very low and clean shave.
Just a wonderful razor. Great value for your money.

Was looking forward to trying this shaver. Haven’t used one for 50 years but the price of blades convinced me to try again. It doesn’t look like any shaver I ever used but ok. Plugged it in to charge for couple of hours then click the ON button. Nothing. Reads full charge but no go . Dead on arrival. Maybe I just got a dud. I will return it and buy a Braun.

reviews.reviewTitle: It doesn’t look very well build
reviews.reviewText: Looks and feels of not a very good quality but so far works fine
